item.title: At number 24, 20th July
item.description:
A motorcycle appearee about 2 weeks ago. The owner doesnt have a permit or it might be abadoned or untaxed. The motorcycle is covered to hide number plate. White-red motorcycle in the local resident's parking bays.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 16, Ponsonby Terrace, Millbank, London

item.title: Flytipped items scattered for months without council intervention, 20th July
item.description:
Suitcase, rugs, cardboard, tables, estate agent sign and black refuse bags full of household rubbish dumped and now scattered. Many have been sitting here for months but additional items now also building up. Council has now cleared up or attempted to deter dumping which is clearly attracted by the roadside open container bins. These themselves attract vermin and rubbish gets pulled out of the bin and scattered across the road and into driveways

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Barforth Road, Nunhead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Single gully AND curb drainage FAILING to protect the CP Subway from flooding above the bridge, 20th July
item.description:
Single gully AND curb drainage FAILING to protect the CP Subway from sustained flooding water above the road bridge. Wide flooding extending on the Crystal Palace Parade over the CP Subway and seen spreading several feet over footway. Flooding VERY slow to drain away. Flood water saturation means water seen inside the CP Subway below. Single gully looks full of grit and sludge inside. Second storm sewer link for curb drainage needed. Road and footway used by as bus stand. Flooding makes access on/off for bus drivers dangerous or very unpleasant wading across a river like flood water from the footway.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crystal Palace Parade, Crystal Palace, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Vista, Middle Park, London
